Royal Plaza Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 16818 reviews

Thank you so much Royal Plaza Hotel for making our first family trip abroad a pleasant experience! Allow me to enumerate the BEST points about the hotel: 1) STAFF is incomparable! Even before we arrived, I've sent them a lot of queries thru email and their responses were always prompt and helpful.

During our entire stay, the staff were very accommodating. We were even upgraded to a suite! Much to the delight of my parents and my child! Truly commendable! :) 2) LOCATION is perfect! RPH is connected to a mall (MOKO) which has an MTR station (Mong Kok East). Very convenient for us since we were traveling with a young child and senior citizens. We were also able to walk going to Ladies Night Market (Tung Choi Street). 3) FACILITIES are excellent. The hotel was quiet and smells so good! Beddings were beyond comfortable which allowed us to rest after a day of walking around. Too bad we were only able to use the swimming pool once due to our tight schedule. We would love to be back! :)

Show more
Kimberley Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 9357 reviews

I booked a 2 nights stay this June and I specified a non-smoking room upon check in. As soon as I entered my assigned room, it was very stuffy and smells like someone just smoked in the room.

The room was located on the 8th floor and there was a bamboo installation just outside my window "view". I went down the hotel lobby again to have a room change, to which the hotel staff obliged and quickly assigned me to a non smoking floor on the 19th floor. They issued a new card key but it didn't work the first time. So I had to go back to the lobby again to check my room access. Such a hassle. Also upon check out, I got bitten by bed bugs and left some nasty dark marks on my legs.

Show more
Maylee , Philippines
L'Hotel Nina et Convention Centre
7.9 Very good
Based on 20270 reviews

Long story short. My suitcase was left inside the taxi, which drove off. The hotel staff could have easily told me it was gone forever and as an American in a non-English speaking town I would have had to have just eaten it.

But no, Sean the manager went way above and beyond the call of duty. First, taxis in Hong Kong are individual businesses. There isn't one giant company you can call. So Sean went on the security cameras of the convention center. Not the hotel. That's how great she was. He went to another security company and asked to see their tapes. He then found the number of the taxi. He then put out a radio announcement to all taxis about a lost baggage. Within 70 minutes, my bag had miraculously returned and my trip was saved. Sean and his crew are truly amazing. This was a level of service I have never seen and will likely never see again. Thank you to everyone at the Nina. I highly recommend this hotel! And the facilities are great too! Fantastic rooms

Show more
Perry , United States
Cordis, Hong Kong
8.7 Excellent
Based on 4467 reviews

I was double-charged for my room, despite canceling a previous reservation and in spite of keeping my booking with Agoda.

Apparently, this is punishment from Cordis ‘in the name of Policy adherence’ done by a reservation manager who cannot or will not think outside the box. Had I actually not stayed at Cordis, I could understand getting charged the full cancellation fee—but I did stay. No one likes to get cheated and I am extremely upset at how Cordis mishandled what should have been a no-brainer. Customer service is more than a forced smile and feigned enthusiasm at my decision to stay at a hotel. I had been under the impression that I had cancelled a double-booking but discovered on a credit card statement that this was not the case. The reservation manager at Cordis should have paused a moment and assessed the situation. Rather than droning on about policy and ‘fine print’, a skilled professional would have done a quick assessment of my booking(s), realised that I was double-booked and would have, without hesitation, canceled it and issued a refund for that double-booking. This could have easily been done with a few keystrokes on the computer. Instead, after an hour of haggling, Cordis still decided that an example needed to be made and punished me with an extra night charge. As a result, they have lost not just me as a customer but also my colleagues who will no longer stay there. Fortunately, there is a plethora of options in Hong Kong to choose from.

Show more
Lorne , Canada
Xi Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 3460 reviews

We had a pleasant time in XI hotel. Quick check in and Kenneth of the front desk was very accommodating.

The hotel is very strategic as it is located near Nathan Road and a just a few steps is K11 mall and Holiday Inn Golden Mile. There are several MTR stations within the area but we always go to the station inside K11 especially when we transferred to Lantau since we have big luggages and they have elevators and escalators. To get there, we took the Airport Express and rode the free shuttle bus going to Kowloon. We stopped at the Holiday Inn and walked towards the hotel. There are several restaurants (including Spring Deer and Ichiran) and bars within the area and is very busy at night. I have no negative comments to say except that the room is a little dark for us and the lobby is small. Overall, I can recommend this hotel to travellers who are always out to shop and looking for a place to stay at night in HK. By the way, the free handy phone is a plus.

Show more
Donna , Philippines
Royal Park Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 4970 reviews

Thank you to the Royal Park Hotel for an exceptional stay. We spent tree nights at this hotel and caught the bus A41 from and to the airport with no problems at all.

The hotel is lined to an amazing shopping centre with all you could need or want. If you want to go further around Hong Kong the Metro station is a short walk away and very easy to use and locate. We went all over HK from this hotel with ease and it was great to return to the hotel for a comfortable nights sleep at the end of very busy days. We returned to the hotel after a two week visit to Vietnam to collect the luggage and shopping we had left. I had a parcel delivered to the hotel and on my arrival it was waiting for me together with the rest of our stooped luggage. We had a short stop over and the hotel allowed us to use their shower facilities before returning to the airport. The friendly smiles and very helpful staff all made for an exceptional stay. i would not stay anywhere else in Hong Kong and will certainly recommend this hotel to anyone lucky enough to visit this exciting city. THANK YOU again Royal Park Hotel and staff.

Show more
Paul , South Africa
Regal Airport Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 7684 reviews

I stayed in the hotel for one night to attend at event at the Asia World Expo close by. As I arrived early, they were able to let me check in to a 2-bed room instead of 1 large bed which was fine since I wanted to check in early.

The room was spacious. The lighting was hard to get a handle on (you have to keep your key card in a slot pushed in hard). Someone came up to help immediately when I called. The main problem was the bathroom. The toilet ran for a long time after being flushed. I turned on the shower and found that the drain was stuck at closed. The switch to open it was broken. I called and it took around 20 minutes for someone to come. This person came in and simply broke the drain plug, taking out the cover and the mechanism below. She asked if it was okay for me if I used it like that and I said fine since it was nearly 1am and I didn't seem to have another choice. She told me that the drain was broken from the start. When I took a shower, the drain still didn't work well, even wide open. I was standing in 2 inches of water the whole time. The proximity to the airport and Expo were nice but I wouldn't stay there if I didn't have that event. There isn't really much around the airport and food choices are pretty expensive. If I were coming for a layover, I would choose a different hotel because it was definitely not worth the amount paid.

Show more
Teresa , South Korea
Best Western Grand Hotel
7.1 Very good
Based on 5032 reviews

We are put on the smoking floor as we did not make the choice for non-smoking floor during booking. The receptionist was kind enough to move us to another room the next morning.

She offered to get housekeeping to spray the room to rid of the cigarette smell for us. What shocked us what the the housekeeper actually told us that we are on a non-smoking floor. As a guest, we had to tell her we are on the smoking floor which is shocking. Finally, she came in with a small freshener and just spray the room which did not helped at all. The next morning, we had to check out of the smoking room and moved our luggage to concierge and re-check in at 2pm for a non-smoking room. The concierge staff was impatient without waiting to listen to explanation and just punch into his computer. After 5 minutes, he says he could not locate our booking...haiz....then he finally listened and kept our luggage for us. The move could have been more pleasant if the hotel staff could have help us moved our luggages especially when I have a 76 year old mother with me.

Show more
Janet , Singapore
Royal Garden Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 2147 reviews

The hotel was OK and the staff were nice overall, but there were things that with a little common sense would completely change this hotel.

First of all, we requested a cot for our 4-month old baby and notified the hotel we arrive late at night. So, instead of setting up the cot in advance to make the arrival much smoother, they kindly told us that they will send someone up to set up the cot. I'm guessing that since guests check out by 12pm, the cot would have been available for about 10 hours already. My biggest issue is that the hotel used to have a whole floor of smoking rooms, but relatively recently changed to a non-smoking hotel. That's fine, but our room on the 8th floor still smelled smoky and since they knew we had an infant, it seemed short-sighted to give us an ex-smoking room (due to the links with sudden infant death syndrome). I know it must be hard to anticipate the needs of hundreds of customers a day. However, if you know in advance that the customer has a baby (which they did), common sense should say don't give them an old smoking room. Unfortunately, that didn't happen and they could only move us for the last night of our 4 night stay.

Show more
Richard , United Kingdom
Prudential Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 7521 reviews

Rude and Lousy check in process and served by a rude and lousy staff, Crystal whom spoilt my day when checking in.

She didn't give a clear explanation though I have repeatedly told her our request. It maybe savaged by her colleague after he took over the case from her when she refused to attend or talk to me. But the hotel reputation has been damaged, I will never never never recommend your hotel to any of my friends. Her impatient in dealing with the guest needs to be treated as a Bad role model for her fellow colleague and shall not be tolerated. If the hotel wants to earn a better reputation with repeat business from the guest Or rather spread the good words By the guest, the front desk check in staff should all be sent for retrain. Nonetheless I would like to compliment the concerige who are flexible and helpful. Helping us to break the mini padlock of our luggage as we accidentally locked the keys in the luggage without hesitation and advising us a cheap and feasible solution to airport on our day of checking out. The smart phone is difficult to operate and unable to tag as hotspot and it's not easy to operate the phone at all. I can't even use it to google when we are out of the hotel though there's a data plan on the phone.

Show more
Choy , Singapore
Regal Riverside Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 9882 reviews

Mold in bathroom, long black hair on my bed after room service, a used toothbrush on the sofa cheapest sandpaper - ups, I meant toilet paper - in the bathroom, mold spot about 10mm diameter on rubber mat for bath tube.

.. seriously? Clearly, management cut corners and staff aint up to the hygienic standard as well. Having that said, the staff on reception was very friendly and helpful - unfortunately we spend more time in the room (even in the bath room) as in the reception area. The Regal Riverside Hotel is always popping up as good barging so we tried it for once - I rather go next time to the Regal Hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui East that is much better maintained.

Show more
Deana , Philippines
Harbour Plaza North Point Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 2941 reviews

I am here to stay for a special occasion, but was quite disappointed with my experience: 1. Wifi - the wifi doesn't work.

It connects for 5 minutes and the line will drop. Have to restart laptop multiple times and it still doesn’t work. Called service centre and the attitude was poor – the guy offered no workable solution nor apology and simply explained the entire building shares the same internet. Almost had to hotspot my own phone for internet. 2. Room – the pictures are misleading and look nothing like the ones uploaded online. We got an old room and was quite run down. Sound insulation was bad and you can hear noises in the corridor. 3. Bed – we requested a double bed but it was actually 2 twin beds put together. Not what I expected for a 4 star hotel 4. Service – Service was poor and not 4 stars standard. When I asked for a couple more water, they said reluctantly, is two bottles enough for you. 5. Check in – it was a long wait (more than 15 min). As my partner checked in first (he didn’t make the booking), they requested a HK$1500 deposit (largely exceeds room cost of HK$1000 – I simply don’t understand what is the rationale behind. I have never been requested such a large deposit in other hotels - also the room was paid in full at booking). 6. Location – convenient but for those who don’t know, it is right next to a funeral home. All in this hotel is at most 3 stars standard and is definitely not value for money (eg basic wifi doesn’t even work!). There are better hotels for this price in HK.

Show more
Tam , Hong Kong
Royal View Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 6987 reviews

We chose this particular hotel because of the size of their rooms, and facilities attached. Room itself is reasonably spacious, with a good view of Lido Beach.

Room presented to be clean and we noted their cleaners actually changing the linen at the end of check-out in one of the bedrooms. Presumebly sound proof rooms as we have had zero disturbance from outside of the room. Toilet / bathroom is quite small though, also dislike the yellow toned towels and the fact that their smallest towels are hand towels (they do not have face washers). Hotel provides shuttle bus transport to MTR station in a nearby district, which is rather convenient as they drop you off right at the station. We ourselves have been utilising the MTR routes during our holiday, only taking taxi if necessary. NOTE: Shuttle bus operates until 10:40pm, 15-30mins intervals depending on the time of the day. If you are planning to catch the shuttle bus during rush hours, be prepared to queue up early or you will not get a seat. Facilities - unfortunately their pool was closed for maintenance. They have a decent sized gym with threadmills, indoor bikes and some pin-loaded weight machines. They have male & female sauna / jaccuzi facilities, male area was closed but female area was neat and comfortable. Lockers & towels available at no extra cost. Overall quite happy with our stay at this hotel.

Show more
Patrick , Australia
Regal Kowloon Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 6084 reviews

Pros: Hotel is conveniently located, very close to East TST MTR station. There are also nice pocket parks in the vicinity, and a stroll along the boardwalk to view the Hong Kong skyline is also another plus.

Breakfast is standard fare, nothing exceptional but would get you by. They also organize luggage drop-offs pretty well, so you can leave your luggage after checking out. Room size is bigger than normal for Hong Kong standards. Cons: Hotel is quite dated. Room in itself has a littled bit more updated furniture, but the bathroom fixtures and tiles are in need of updating. Hotel lifts are excruciatingly slow though, and became bothersome after a while. All in all, probably a decent enough hotel, as it is probably one of the lowest-priced hotels in the area. But could be better, as a few key improvements would make it a real score.

Show more
Pocholo , Philippines
Ibis Hong Kong Central & Sheung Wan Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 10110 reviews

Pros: Nice hotel, good facilities, helps that it is a designated stop of the free airport express shuttle, Comfy stay, staff courteous, clean rooms Cons: a bit of a walk to the nearest mtr station (at least there's the ding ding but that's slower and crowded most times), away from most shops, restos so you have to take mtr.

But public transport is easy anyway so it's ok I guess, room has limited closet space. Shower area is small, soap bars are small,

Show more
Angelo , Philippines
The Cityview Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 7108 reviews

I stayed more than 5 times at this hotel. Love this hotel because the EXCELLENT location. MTR Yau Ma Tei is just around the corner and many bus lines stop right next the hotel.

Temple street, Ladies market, shopping area Mong Kok, Tsim Sha Tsui, innumerable restaurants are on walking distance. Laundry is just on the opposite of the main entrance of the hotel. There is also a small 7/11 (supermarket) just on the corner. The space of the room is according standard of Hong Kong just fine. I stayed mostly in the premier room which suits maximum 3 persons and that's okay. Also if you book the premier room you can use the handy wifi spot which you can take outside so you have ALWAYS wifi with you. It's free and very very nice! The breakfast is fine and if you stayed for 2 weeks (in my case) than it will be a little bit boring at the end;-). Oriental part: congee, noodles, vegetables, miso soup and dim sum. Western part: mini croissants & sweet patries, toast, gluten free bread, juice, milk, yoghurt, fresh fruits (very day: watermelon, pineapple and dragon fruit), cheese and the cook prepares any various egg. In general the hotel staff is very polite, friendly and helpfull. Also the chambermaids are very friendly especially the lady who cleans our room 1084. Thank you so much! I can highly recommend this hotel especially if you don't stay long in Hong Kong. Because the excellent location you will save a lot of travel time.

Show more
Lin , Netherlands
The Royal Pacific Hotel and Towers
7.9 Very good
Based on 8059 reviews

The hotel continues to impress with the quality service and accommodation. Not only the standards are maintained at high level, they have also made noticeable improvements.

The renovated bathroom is bigger, new accessories and the water heater works well. For same floor area, they have removed unnecessary sofa chair or table extension, and overall the room is relatively more spacious. I have stayed in this hotel many times previously.

Show more
Boon , Singapore
Gateway Hotel (Marco Polo)
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2806 reviews

This hotel is situated at the heart of harbour city. The mall is accessible at the lobby and via elevator at the 2nd flr.

Buffet breakfast is awesome @ three on canton. Selection was great, pastries and bread tasted good. It starts at 6am to 10:30am but you can stay up to finish your food. Shopping is a breeze since all the nice brands are situated in this mall. The room itself is nice and clean. Their staff are fluent in english and very accomodating. Internet in the room is sometimes slow. The cable channels are SD with mostly sports channel and with one movie channel. No CNN or HBO. The room comes with a free smartphone which you can use to call any number in Hong kong or the Philippines for free. We enjoyed our stay here and we would definitely come back again.

Show more
Redan , Philippines
Shamrock Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 5560 reviews

Everything was perfect for this hotel. Location wise just next to mtr station which is convenience for travellers, nearby there is mannings, 711 and various of famous dining store.

Staff was friendly too for reception, janitor and others. Room check in and lugage storage service was quick and there is staff service for lobby main door and lift too. Room size consider as huge in Hong Kong and everything is fine in the room except for the hair dryer, the speed is too slow, need long hour to get the hair dry. Wifi speed and cleanliness in the room was fine too. Even though the price is abit steep compared to some other hotels, but is total value for the money for the above positive points. I'm totally happy with they stay in Shamrock Hotel for this trip :)

Show more
yen , Malaysia
Eco Tree Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1182 reviews

The Good: 1. Rate - Since it wasn't a busy day during my stay, I was able to get a swell deal on my online travel agent.

I'm not really a fan of booking through OTAs but Eco Tree Hotel but their rate that day was too good to pass. 2. Fragrance - The moment you step into the hotel entrance, to the reception desk, and finally to the guest rooms, you will be greeted by a familiar sweet smell. 3. Location - Can be tricky to locate depending on types of travellers. However, it's just NEXT to Sai Ying Pun MTR Station Exit A2. Tram stops and bus stops are reachable. I thought ma wan is far from the town but it is a lot faster to get there than I imagine. 20+ min ferry will take you from central to ma wan pier n an extra 10min walk to the hotel by following the sign. Warm reminder to check the ferry schedule or you may have to wait for half or even an hour for the next ferry. Taking bus is an alternative if you get there from Kowloon side but you may suffer from a long queue or traffic if you chose a rush hour. It is just fine otherwise. Get off bus at first stop off tsingma bridge, down the lift to lowest level and follow the sign. Just a few minutes. Overall, we are very satisfactory with our stay at Noah's ark and would definitely recommend it. Just remember to bring your own breakfast!

This was the worst accomodation experience either of us have ever had. While the room standard was acceptable for the price (despite stained and dirty bed linen) and Tsim Sha Tsui is the perfect place to base yourself for a short holiday in Hong Kong, the staff and owner of this hotel are greedy, extortionate, and left us fearing for our safety.

The ordeal started with a mishap with the dates of our booking, which we resolved the next day by organising with one of the hotel staff to give us one free night accommodation as we had ended up paying for one of our nights twice. We were relocated to another of the owner's hotels in the Chung King Mansions which was fine, we thought the issue had been resolved. When we arrived back at our hotel on the evening of the night of our free stay we were accosted at the elevator by the staff member who we had sorted out the booking with. He told us that the owner had changed his mind and we had to pay to stay the night. When we refused on the basis that we had already been told twice that the night would be free, it turned into a 45 minute debacle of phone calls and arguing. After eventually sorting the issue out with a threat of reporting the owner to the police, it was requested in an ominous and unfriendly manner that I should follow the staff member to "visit" the owner in another building on my own and my girlfriend was to stay and would not want to come. Feeling threatened by this situation (the Chung King Mansions have lots of dark alleys and seedy characters, and it was already after midnight) I refused to go as we could only imagine what their intentions were. The next night our door was knocked on multiple times after 11pm which was strange and unprofessional so we ignored it. While the Chung King Mansion is a lively and interesting place during the day I would not recommend arriving or walking around it after 10pm for solo female travellers.

Delta Deluxe Hotel
7.2 Very good
Based on 315 reviews

Rooms are tiny but immaculate. Daily housekeeping. Friendly owners and staff present around the clock.

Single room had its own (Asian style) bathroom, TV, phone, hair dryer. Some toiletries provided. Pillow is a bit hard, but good if you're a back or side sleeper. Overall, great value for solo budget travelers. Conveniently close to entrance of Chungking Mansions. Central location right off bus A21 from the airport (stop 14), easy access to 2 subway lines, Kowloon Park and lots of museums and shops within walking distance. A lot of people think the area is sketchy, but most people of all ethnicities are very nice if a tad aggressive with their marketing. Lots of cheap tasty Indian food in the Mansions (Ali Baba has a great 20 HKD breakfast special, and the vegetarian place a little further back has amazing samosas and Indian sweets), inexpensive laundromat in the back of the ground floor. Keep your wits about you, and you'll be fine. Diverse and interesting place!

I was initially concerned about the place because I heard a lot of horror stories about Chungking and Mirador Mansions but if you're just looking for a budget friends, safe and clean place to sleep while you're in Hong Kong, then this 3D Inn - Dragon is definitely worth considering.

Apple Hostel
7.9 Very good
Based on 139 reviews

My friend and I stayed 5 days 4 nights in a basic double room. The bed/pillows/blanket were a pleasant surprise--clean and soft.

The room was cleaned (blankets folded, trash taken out, towels replaced) daily. The bathroom was a combined toilet/sink/shower area and was decently clean. Note that towels and flip-flops are provided. Soap was available but no shampoo or hair-dryer. Both hot and cold water (and mugs) were provided, but bring your own bottle. As others have said, Chungking Mansions (the name of the building) has many Indian stall-keepers and taxi drivers, and on the first two days, many continuously approached me and my friend. Like another review mentioned, if they try to tell you about their hostel, just tell them you already have a booking, and they will leave you alone. We did feel nervous and somewhat threatened (two college-aged girls). However, after the first two days, they probably remembered us and stopped actively bothering us. Also, at the waiting area for the elevators, there is a guard who helps operate the elevators and makes you feel much safer. Note, however, that he likely gets off duty by/around midnight (we came back around 1am one night and he wasn't there). Location is fantastic because Tsim Sha Tsui is only one stop from Admiralty, where you can switch to the blue line to access all the places on Hong Kong Island (Victoria's Peak, Ocean Park, Dragon's Peak hike). Also, Tsim Sha Tsui is conveniently on one end of Nathan Road, which we walked all along (instead of taking MTR red line) to get to many of the places we wanted to go (Ladies' Market, Temple Street).

Watch out for the Taxi ripoff scheme where they will say that you've gotta pay an extra fee for either an Airport Fee or extra Baggage Fee.

....that is a scam!! You pay the meter fee and nothing extra!! Report that Taxi Driver/Cab Number with the piece of paper that is given to you at the airport Taxi service pickup area, if the Taxi Driver tries to scam you for extra fees, and be sure to ask that attendant if you have to pay any extra fees over and above what the meter shows, before getting in ANY of those Airport Taxis!!! If a restaurant charges a 10% fee in their bill, that is the tip for the waitress/waiter!! Don't pay anything over the total bill, if you see that 10% fee on the bill! Great advice from Dan! The subway Tram/Train can take you all the way to the Airport, too! Just follow the color-coded Tram Lines in the Tram/Train.....I think it's on the same line as the Disney-bound Tram, or that general direction! It would be a good idea to do a dry run (on one of your vacation days) from your Hotel, all the way to the Int'l Airport to verify that it'll get you there, as it'll be cheaper than a Taxi ride! Traveler impressions of Hong Kong

Always a delight to come to HKG. Getting around is so easy, the food is good everywhere. It's not cheap, but who cares? A few days in HKG will always guarantee a full recharge from stress.

MEDINA ,Philippines

Hong Kong is like any international city expensive and crowded. Expect to queue to eat in restaurants and the food isn't exactly world class.

Everything is expensive, even luxury goods considering there is no tax. Hong Kong is a must see place, but by no means the best city in Asia.

Show more
Wilkins ,United Kingdom

Getting old but still has its charm. Plenty of shopping and dining options, eastern and western. Bit too much bustle for my taste and it reminds me too much of Chinese cities where everything's kinda dirty and old.

Really convenient public transportation and a world class airport make transiting through here a breeze.

Show more
Chew ,Singapore

Note that people living in Hong Kong don't talk English that much. It is quite difficult to speak to them or get an answer and some may actually sound rude and act rude.

If you are good at following directions and looking at maps, you'll be fine. You don't need to talk to anyone a lot. I love HongKong because I can go different places via the MTR with no fuss and I can walk around and feel safe. I love that I can go shopping anywhere and I always have somewhere to go. I will always come back to HongKong.

More about Hong Kong

Hong Kong is one of Asia's most relevant cities where an influx of business travelers and tourists continue to come in increasing numbers. Most visitors arrive via Hong Kong International Airport. From here, business travelers can connect to sophisticated airport hotels while tourists transfer to hotels in Hong Kong’s city center.

A proper tour begins on the main island, where the British first established a colony at what has become Central District. Hong Kong South is a hotspot for modern building projects while Hong Kong Island West, Mongkok, and Yau Ma Tei are laid out in traditional Chinese neighborhoods. East of Central, Wanchai holds a booming selection of Hong Kong business hotels as well as a healthy night scene.

From North Point, it's a short jaunt across Causeway Bay to Kowloon City, the city's commercial heart. At the top of the peninsula, Tsim Sha Tsui district hosts ultra-modern shopping malls like Harbour City. This is also where the best selection of accommodation in Hong Kong comes together in a smash of upscale giants, backpacker haunts and classic historic venues.

Had I actually not stayed at Cordis, I could understand getting charged the full cancellation fee—but I did stay. Customer service is more than a forced smile and feigned enthusiasm at my decision to stay at a hotel. I had been under the impression that I had cancelled a double-booking but discovered on a credit card statement that this was not the case. If I were coming for a layover, I would choose a different hotel because it was definitely not worth the amount paid. Most visitors arrive via Hong Kong International Airport . From here, business travelers can connect to sophisticated airport hotels while tourists transfer to hotels in Hong Kong’s city center. A proper tour begins on the main island, where the British first established a colony at what has become Central District. Hong Kong South is a hotspot for modern building projects while Hong Kong Island West, Mongkok, and Yau Ma Tei are laid out in traditional Chinese neighborhoods. East of Central, Wanchai holds a booming selection of Hong Kong business hotels as well as a healthy night scene. From North Point, it's a short jaunt across Causeway Bay to Kowloon City, the city's commercial heart. At the top of the peninsula, Tsim Sha Tsui district hosts ultra-modern shopping malls like Harbour City . This is also where the best selection of accommodation in Hong Kong comes together in a smash of upscale giants, backpacker haunts and classic historic venues.
